result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. April Marie Blaker

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on November 7, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

1:18 PM Defendant April Marie Blaker not in court.  Attorney Travis S Slattery not in court.  Attorney Lynne K Van Hollen appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 22CF60 and 22CF83.  Def is in custody in Oneida County.  Cases were scheduled to appear for sentencing.  JA coordinate with DA and Atty to schedule a sentencing hearing.
Internal review scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:00 am.

1:39 PM Defendant April Marie Blaker appeared by video, in custody from ACJ.  Attorney Lynne K Van Hollen appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  FTA 9/6/22.  Warrant quashed.  Possibility def turned self.    114 2nd Ave east Ashland Wi also residence, not employed.  State comments on bail/bond.  Def left video room while State was commenting.  Bail revoked in each case.  JA to contact Atty Slattery if he is available and change if not.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Scheduling conference on September 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:19 PM Defendant April Marie Blaker not in court.  Attorney Travis S Slattery in court for April Marie Blaker.  Attorney Lynne K Van Hollen appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 22CF83, 22CF60, and 21CF188.  Court notes that in reviewing the PSI report def did not make herself available to investigator.  State is asking for a warrant.  Court orders warrants, BOW, state is also asking for forfeiture of bail, court orders forfeiture of bonds, send notice if Def fails to respond with in 30 days judgment will enter.
to Judge S fr DOC (re: PSI)
Sentencing hearing on September 6, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

11:25 AM Defendant April Marie Blaker in court.  Attorney Lynne K Van Hollen appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Travis S Slattery in court for April Marie Blaker.  Cases 21CF188, 22CF83, 22CF60.  State comments cases 22CF83 and 22CF60 are Judge McKnight's cases if Court takes under general assignment there is a global resolution with case 21CF188.  All parties in agreement.  Court takes cases 22CF83 and 22CF60 under general assignment.  22CF83 and 22CF60 def waives right to preliminary hearing in these cases, court finds knowingly, voluntarily, intelligently waiving right, accepts waivers, bound over arraignment.  Court finds probable cause in both cases.  State comments on the elements for the cases.  
21CF188 DRI 2 and CT 1 and 3 DEF PLEADS NO CONTEST.  Court finds factual basis exists.  Court accepts no contest pleas and finds guilty CT 1 and CT 3, judgment to enter.  
22CF60 DRI 2 and 4, CT 1, 3 DEF PLEADS NO CONTEST.  Court finds on complaint that factual basis exists.  Court accepts no contest pleas and finds guilty CT 1 and CT 3, judgment to enter.  
22CF83 DRI 2, 3, 4, 5, CT 1 DEF PLEADS NO CONTEST.  Court finds factual basis exists.  Court accepts no contest plea and finds guilty on CT 1, judgment to enter.  
PSI to be ordered and argue sentencing.
22CF83 Atty motion to modify bond to accommodate CPS order.  State no objection, to allow contact with robert powless for visitation with joint children, with understanding it is supervised, and contact to only be in that setting.  Court grants modification.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Offer to Settle
Status conference on July 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:01 AM April Blaker appeared from ACJ via Zoom video. Lynne Van Hollen appear for State of WI via Zoom video. Atty Brewer appearing 22CF60 and New Charges -- Court has reviewed PC -- court finds PC Def has commited a crime in Ashland County -- see PC for wording below. 20CF60 -- court confused w/ Def and Atty. Atty Arbuckle withdrew -- signed yesterday. Atty Slatterly doesn't appear today. State commenting -- Atty Slatterly has Def and a case w/ Judge Stella -- plea/stc --Judge Stella take this case under general assignment global resolution. 21CF188 -- Judge Stella's case. Court to adjourn case 22CF60 to see if a global resolution w/ Stella. If case is resolved w/ Judge Stella before 7/11, this hearing can come off calendar. If not resolved, continue w/ 7/11 hearing. New Charges -- Address: 114 2nd Ave E, Ashland, WI 54806, Employed @ Ashland Rehab Center. Not on Probation. State asking for additional $500.00 cash, ABSOL, NC w/ R.P. or J.B. Def commenting on bail/bond -- has no money. Court orders: New Charges: $250.00 cash bail, NC w/ R.P. and J.B, and ABSOL. Inital appr on 7/11, STC on 22CF60. If Def at liberty, appear in-person.  Status conference scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Def shall not possess or consume any mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Def is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold there.
